parameters.query: SELECT value FROM config WHERE key = COALESCE($1, '')

INSERT INTO config (key, value, updated_at)
VALUES ($1, $2, NOW())
ON CONFLICT (key) DO UPDATE
SET value = EXCLUDED.value, updated_at = NOW()
RETURNING key, value

options.queryReplacement: ={{ $('Parse Command and Args').item.json.args[0] }},={{ $('Parse Command and Args').item.json.args.slice(1).join(' ') }}

parameters.query:
SELECT 
  (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM activity_log WHERE timestamp >= CURRENT_DATE) as activities_today,
  (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM notes WHERE timestamp >= DATE_TRUNC('week', CURRENT_DATE)) as notes_this_week,
  (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM raw_events WHERE source_type = 'discord') as total_events,
  (SELECT last_observation_at FROM user_state LIMIT 1) as last_activity

-- Get recent activities or notes based on subcommand
-- Simplified: run appropriate query based on first param
SELECT 
  'activity' as type,
  a.id,
  SUBSTRING(a.id::text, 1, 8) as short_id,
  a.timestamp,
  ac.name as category_name,
  a.description as text
FROM activity_log a
JOIN activity_categories ac ON a.category_id = ac.id
WHERE $1::text IN ('activities', 'activity', '')
ORDER BY a.timestamp DESC
LIMIT $2::int

UNION ALL

SELECT 
  'note' as type,
  n.id,
  SUBSTRING(n.id::text, 1, 8) as short_id,
  n.timestamp,
  nc.name as category_name,
  COALESCE(n.title, '') || CASE WHEN n.title IS NOT NULL THEN ': ' ELSE '' END || LEFT(n.text, 50) as text
FROM notes n
JOIN note_categories nc ON n.category_id = nc.id
WHERE $1::text IN ('notes', 'note')
ORDER BY n.timestamp DESC
LIMIT $2::int;

options.queryReplacement: ={{ $('Parse Command and Args').item.json.args[0] || 'activities' }},={{ parseInt($('Parse Command and Args').item.json.args[1]) || 10 }}

parameters.query:
SELECT 
  user_login,
  sleeping,
  last_observation_at,
  EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (NOW() - last_observation_at))/60 as minutes_since_activity
FROM user_state
LIMIT 1

parameters.jsCode:
// Handle help command
const event = $('When Executed by Another Workflow').first().json.event;

const helpText = `üìö **Available Commands**

**Configuration:**
\`::get <key>\` - Get a config value
\`::set <key> <value>\` - Set a config value

**Information:**
\`::stats\` - Show activity statistics
\`::recent activities [N]\` - Show last N activities (default 10)
\`::recent notes [N]\` - Show last N notes (default 10)
\`::status\` - Show your current state

**Data Management:**
\`::delete activity <short-id> [<id2> ...]\` - Delete activities by short ID
\`::delete note <short-id> [<id2> ...]\` - Delete notes by short ID

**System:**
\`::ping\` - Test if system is working
\`::help\` - Show this message

**Config Keys:**
- \`north_star\` - Your guiding principle
- \`summary_time\` - Daily summary time (format: HH:MM or HH, e.g., "20:00" or "20")

**Examples:**
\`::set north_star Focus on deep work\`
\`::recent activities 20\`
\`::delete activity a1b2c3d4\`
\`::delete activity e5f6g7h8 i9j0k1l2\` (multiple)`;

return {
  response: helpText,
  ...event
};

parameters.query:
-- Delete activity or note by short ID (first 8 chars of UUID)
-- Args: item_type (activity|note), short_id1, short_id2, ...
WITH short_ids_input AS (
  SELECT unnest(ARRAY[$2, $3, $4, $5, $6, $7, $8, $9, $10]::text[]) as short_id
  WHERE unnest(ARRAY[$2, $3, $4, $5, $6, $7, $8, $9, $10]::text[]) != ''
),
deleted_activities AS (
  DELETE FROM activity_log
  WHERE $1 = 'activity'
    AND EXISTS (
      SELECT 1 FROM short_ids_input 
      WHERE activity_log.id::text LIKE short_ids_input.short_id || '%'
    )
  RETURNING id, timestamp, description as text, 'activity' as type
),
deleted_notes AS (
  DELETE FROM notes
  WHERE $1 = 'note'
    AND EXISTS (
      SELECT 1 FROM short_ids_input 
      WHERE notes.id::text LIKE short_ids_input.short_id || '%'
    )
  RETURNING id, timestamp, title || ': ' || text as text, 'note' as type
)
SELECT * FROM deleted_activities
UNION ALL
SELECT * FROM deleted_notes;
